entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued May 23 at 9:30AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory is in effect... * SURF...Surf heights of 10 to 12 feet tonight will build to 11 to 14 feet on Tuesday. Highest surf will be on south and east facing shores. * TIMING...through Saturday. * IMPACTS...Large surfs and strong rip currents.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued May 23 at 3:01PM PDT until May 25 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Very Hot Temperatures Tuesday and Wednesday... .High pressure over interior northern California will result in triple digit temperatures across much of the Valley on Tuesday and Wednesday with the hottest temperatures on Wednesday. Hot temperatures combined with warm overnight lows will result in widespread moderate heat risk to locally high heat risk.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 2:18PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...COLD TEMPERATURES EXPECTED ACROSS NORTHERN WISCONSIN TONIGHT... Another cold night is on tap across northern Wisconsin tonight as low temperatures are forecast to drop into the 30s. Clouds are expected to increase overnight and prevent widespread frost from developing.
